TopicTitle: Interstellar's Radiators and Ferram Aerospace hate each other (rockets flip out)

Articles.Content: Whenever I try to launch the huge radiators from the Interstellar mod, my rockets wibble wobble snap apart shortly after launch (at approx 200 m/s) . I'm using Ferram Aerospace and Procedural Fairings, and Kerbal Joint Reinforcement. Now, Ferram usually makes things easier (read: less dV to reach orbit), but the mod is acting like the radiators are deployed even when they're stowed inside the fairing. Apparently this is a problem with Interstellar, not Ferram. In any case, I need a fix for this problem if I'm going to construct big things in orbit. I just need help on a lot of things, really.
Make sure you have updated both mods (Ferram is on 13.3 and interstellar is on .11) so see if updating fixes things, also Don't deploy your radiators inside the atmosphere, they will fall off.

I do need to update Ferram, not sure about Interstellar.

I do need to update Ferram, not sure about Interstellar.

That might be your problem then. I would update both of them just to be sure (Even if you already have the latest version of interstellar)
